title: Self-Serve Upgrade Flow
description: Enable users to upgrade tiers directly in the product instead of emailing sales.

outcomes.clear_success: Upgrade flow shipped and 34% of signups now self-serve upgrade within 14 days; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: The flow works but only 18% of users complete it; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Self-serve upgrades skew higher tier but 23% lower ACV than sales-assisted deals; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Upgrade button is live and conversion is 7%; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Pricing logic bug let 156 users upgrade at 2019 pricing; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Freemium Tier Launch
description: Create a free plan with limited features to expand TAM and Should drive top-of-funnel volume significantly.

outcomes.clear_success: Freemium launched and Signups tripled in six weeks; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Freemium brought volume but conversion is 8%; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Free users now dominate feature requests and the backlog shifted to freeware use cases; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Signup volume is there but day-30 retention is 19%; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A free user created a 4.2 million record project and took shared infra down for 2 hours; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: In-App Activation Tutorial
description: Build guided tour that walks new users through core workflows without leaving the product.

outcomes.clear_success: Tutorial shipped and Time to first meaningful action dropped from 18 minutes to 11; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Tutorial cuts activation time by 6 minutes; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: The tutorial nails the happy path and hides the advanced features people paid for; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Tutorial has a 34% skip-through rate; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: Tutorial tracking leaked memory and After 10 minutes the tab ate 800MB; update your resume.

title: Usage Analytics Dashboard
description: Self-service analytics showing users how much they're actually using the product and Increases stickiness by making value visible.

outcomes.clear_success: Dashboard launched; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Dashboard is used and weekly actives are up 6%; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Customer success turned the dashboard into a renewal weapon; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Dashboard shipped and only 19% ever visit it; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Aggregation query ran unindexed for 5 days; legal wants a meeting.

title: Notification Preference Center
description: Let users control what emails and in-app alerts they receive and Should reduce unsubscribe rates and inbox spam complaints.

outcomes.clear_success: Preference center shipped and Unsubscribes dropped from 3.2% to 1.8%; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Preference center is live and Unsubscribes fell 1.4 points, not the 1.8 we modeled; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users turned off billing alerts and finance found three failed cards 60 days later; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Preference center exists but is buried three clicks deep and Only 6% ever find it; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Preferences did not sync to the backend and users opted out; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Mobile App Redesign
description: Modernize the mobile experience to match web capabilities and Should unlock mobile-first segment.

outcomes.clear_success: Redesigned app shipped on iOS and Android; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Redesign shipped and DAU is up 24%; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Mobile-first users started filing requests that make no sense on web and the roadmap split in two; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Redesign shipped and mobile metrics did not move; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: iOS 2.0 sync bug dropped local changes on the floor; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Knowledge Base Expansion
description: Build out self-serve documentation and how-to guides to deflect common support questions and Low engineering effort, high content burden.

outcomes.clear_success: Knowledge base launched with 47 core articles; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: KB shipped with 32 articles; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: KB started ranking above marketing pages and Unqualified traffic now reads advanced docs they cannot use; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: KB has 40 articles but only 6% of support questions reference them; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: An article was correct for v2.3 and wrong for v3.1; update your resume.

title: Referral Program Launch
description: Users earn credits for referring other users and Should drive organic acquisition.

outcomes.clear_success: Referral program shipped and 12% of new signups come from existing users; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Program launched and 6% of signups are referrals, better than organic but not the 15% model; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Top 50 users drove 40% of referrals; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Program is live and participation is 3%; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Referral credits stacked with loyalty discounts and self-referrals; legal wants a meeting.

title: Feature Gating by Tier
description: Gate advanced features behind higher tier plans, encourage in-product upgrades and Should increase conversion velocity and feature adoption.

outcomes.clear_success: Gates shipped and 14% of users convert within 7 days; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Gates deployed and Conversion at gate-hit is 8%; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Enterprise customers hit freemium gates because of tier mapping; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Gates exist but the upgrade flow is confusing and users hit the paywall; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Gate logic bug let enterprise users share API keys with free users; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: User Segmentation Engine
description: Dynamically segment users by behavior to personalize experience and messaging and Should improve activation and retention.

outcomes.clear_success: Segmentation engine shipped and we can target power users; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Segmentation works but we only have 4 segments instead of 9; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Segmentation revealed an at-risk persona nobody planned for; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Segments exist but targeting does not and Infrastructure without strategy is just a fancy spreadsheet; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: Batch job race condition reassigned segments all day and users saw three onboarding flows in one session; update your resume.

title: Developer API Documentation
description: Ship self-serve API docs and SDKs to unlock developer integrations and Should expand use cases and integration opportunities.

outcomes.clear_success: API docs and Python/JS SDKs launched; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Docs are live and Interest increased but not dramatically; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Two developers built alternative UIs on top of the API and started reselling; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Docs exist but usage is light and Most users want clicks, not code; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Docs included an example with an undocumented admin parameter and Eight customers used it; legal wants a meeting.

title: Pricing Page Redesign
description: Simplify pricing to make tier comparison easier and reduce sales friction and Should improve conversion before trial.

outcomes.clear_success: Pricing page simplified to three tiers; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Redesigned page lifted trial conversion 12%; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: New comparisons made the mid-tier look silly and Most signups now skip to the top tier; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Page looks modern but conversion is unchanged; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Monthly versus annual toggle bug showed monthly prices for annual plans for 6 days; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Community Forum
description: Ship a community forum where users can ask questions.

outcomes.clear_success: Forum launched and power users answer questions; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Forum is active but uneven and Some categories get answers in minutes, others in days; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Forum became a place to discuss pricing and competitors; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Forum exists with 12 posts, most from support trying to seed it; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: A wrong billing integration answer was marked as the solution by 47 users; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Template Library
description: Curate templates for common use cases to help users get started faster and Quick value delivery.

outcomes.clear_success: Template library launched with 8 templates; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Templates are live and 14% of new users use them; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users copy templates and then hack them into shapes they were never designed for; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Template library is invisible and Only 8% of new users know it exists; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: A template built on a beta workflow no longer works and 340 users hit errors; update your resume.

title: Search and Filter Overhaul
description: Improve search relevance and faceted filtering to help users find what they need and Should reduce time-to-task.

outcomes.clear_success: Search rebuilt with relevance ranking and filters; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Search improved but top results are relevant 73% of the time; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Better search surfaced niche features and shifted support from where is X to how do I use X; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: ML ranking shipped and results feel unpredictable; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Date indexing bug stored timestamps as integers and Filters returned chaos for 9 days, we disabled them to stop the bleeding,; legal wants a meeting.

title: Integrations Marketplace
description: Platform for third-party integrations with popular tools and Should expand product value without building every integration ourselves.

outcomes.clear_success: Marketplace launched with 12 integrations; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Marketplace live with 7 integrations; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Third-party integrations exposed product gaps we ignored and the Slack integration made real-time notifications a promise we do not keep; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Marketplace exists but only 6% connect an integration; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: A Zapier integration sent duplicate records every 4 hours for 400 customers; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.

title: Dark Mode Interface
description: Ship dark mode to satisfy power users and reduce eye strain complaints and nice-to-have quality of life feature.

outcomes.clear_success: Dark mode shipped and 47% adoption in two weeks; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: Dark mode live with 28% adoption; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Late-night usage in Asia jumped and session timing shifted; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: Dark mode adoption is 11%; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Global invert CSS nuked SVG chart readability and 1,200 power users reported broken visuals; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: Localization and i18n
description: Expand into non-English markets with localized UI and i18n support and Should unlock international expansion.

outcomes.clear_success: i18n shipped with Spanish and German; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Spanish and German are live; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Localization exposed English-centric assumptions in dates, currency, and idioms; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Framework shipped but only English and Spanish are live; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: German copy mixed formal and informal pronouns; update your resume.

title: Smart Defaults for Setup
description: Implement smart defaults based on company size and industry to reduce initial configuration burden.

outcomes.clear_success: Smart defaults shipped and Time to first meaningful action dropped 11 minutes; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Defaults are live and Setup time dropped 7 minutes but 22% of users override immediately; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Enterprise prospects read the defaults as a signal we are too basic; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Defaults depend on a signup questionnaire users skip; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Manufacturing defaults created 3,000 wrong records on signup; legal wants a meeting.

title: Single Sign-On Integration
description: Support SSO (SAML, OAuth) for enterprise customers and Should reduce enterprise sales friction and increase security perception.

outcomes.clear_success: SSO shipped and enterprise deal velocity improved; leadership takes a victory lap.
outcomes.partial_success: SSO works for Okta and Azure AD; we call it progress.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: SSO turned us into a compliance artifact with their IT change windows; we pretend that was the plan.
outcomes.soft_failure: SSO exists but customers did not adopt it; we blame 'execution risk'.
outcomes.catastrophe: Token refresh bug left users logged in; this becomes a quarterly lesson.

title: In-App Feedback Widget
description: Collect qualitative feedback from users without leaving the product and Should drive product development priorities.

outcomes.clear_success: Feedback widget shipped and 340 submissions in month one; it becomes a QBR 'win'.
outcomes.partial_success: Widget is live and collected 120 pieces of feedback; it still makes the slide deck.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Feedback surfaced heavy use of a feature we thought was dead and Roadmap adjusted to serve the quiet segment; nobody had that in the model.
outcomes.soft_failure: Widget exists but only 2% of users click it; it goes into the learning pile.
outcomes.catastrophe: Multiline feedback truncated at 50 characters; update your resume.

title: A/B Testing Framework
description: Infrastructure for rapid A/B testing of product changes and Enables data-driven decisions.

outcomes.clear_success: A/B testing framework is production-ready and First 12 experiments drove 3-4% improvements; someone writes "great job" in all-hands.
outcomes.partial_success: Framework is live with six experiments running and Rigor is solid; we declare victory and move on.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Experiments showed segments respond differently to the same change and Segmented strategies became necessary,; it wasn't in the deck, but sure.
outcomes.soft_failure: Framework exists but adoption is low; a retro bullet absorbs the pain.
outcomes.catastrophe: Variant assignment bug broke randomization by timezone and Ninety days of experiments were invalid; legal wants a meeting.

title: Getting Started Checklist
description: Add a lightweight checklist that nudges users through three key setup steps and Low effort, should lift activation.

outcomes.clear_success: Checklist shipped and Activation improved; the exec summary suddenly has room.
outcomes.partial_success: Checklist exists with 31% completion; the footnote does the heavy lifting.
outcomes.unexpected_impact: Users treat checklist items as requirements and support gets tickets about steps they cannot complete yet; the roadmap did not mention this part.
outcomes.soft_failure: Checklist is ignored with a 7% completion rate; the postmortem gets a new slide.
outcomes.catastrophe: Checklist step linked to a broken flow and New users got stuck in a loop; everyone pretends it was unforeseeable.
